TopicTitle: Delta IV Heavy/Orion EFT-1 Replica (With launch tower)

Articles.Content:
Probably one of the most powerful rockets to have ever been built (Other than the Saturn V), the Delta IV is well-known for the Orion EFT-1 mission which it took place as a launcher. It has sent up many other payloads (notably for the military) ever since its debut launch in 2004.

It's very stable and rather simple to control, especially with SAS on (For some odd reason.)

It comes in two versions - it's conventional layout (Fill it with a payload of your choice), or an Orion EFT-1 attached on it (Different fairings, different payloads.)

Delta IV Heavy - Conventional

With a normal layout and conventional fairings, this doesn't come with a payload, although it can be flown as is.

It should be able to take up to 7.5 tons without modifications to the launcher itself. Be careful though - Without payload, it's slightly wobbly!

Launch Profile, Action Groups and Operation:

Launch Profile - mileage may vary:

Keep SAS on - Launch straight up until 2,000 m, or whatever you feel is most efficient.

At that altitude, start slowly leaning toward the "22.5" mark.

By 5,000 m, you should be halfway to 45 degrees in the navball.

And by 10,000, you should be at 45 degrees already - Continue until the stage runs out.

If you're aiming for a rather low altitude, you may want to increase your turn even more, but otherwise - burn until desired altitude.

As usual, an insertion burn should send you into orbit.

EFT-1 Users, don't decouple your Cryogenic Upper Stage - You'll need that to deorbit!

Action Groups -

The majority of the functions are equipped in the staging, so not much - 

Orion EFT-1 Users - Abort triggers the fairings, and ignites the LES - The sequence for aborting.

Custom01 - Toggles the Cryogenic Upper Stage.

Custom02 - Separates main CM from the rest of the craft.
